7.1. Region Record

  


Requirements

Overview: The Solution uses Region records to group customers together for easier check-in scheduling and action.

  


Accessed via: 

  * The Region field on the Customer record
  * The Regions reports



  


Sections and Fields: 

  * Region Details section:
    * Active (checkbox; defaults to checked; prevent deactivating the Region if there are any Customers linked to it - error on save: "This Region cannot be deactivated because there is one or more linked Customers."
    * Region Name (required; plain text field; validate against duplicate Region Names)
    * Region Notes (optional; plain text field; used for internal reference)
    * Sales Rep (required; drop list of Employee Contacts) 



  


  * Scheduled Check-Ins section:
    * Months (at least one selection is required; list of checkboxes for "Every Month" and each month of the year; if "Every Month" is checked, all of the months are checked; if one or more of the months are not checked, "Every Month" is unchecked; 
    * Check-In Schedule (auto-set and read-only; displays the selected schedule in text form, for example:)  
      * "Every Month"
      * "Every January" 
      * "Every January, April, July, and October"
    * Next Check-In Month (auto-set and read-only; displays the top item from the "Future Check-Ins embedded spreadsheet; this is the next month in which a Check-In is due) 
    * Future Check-Ins (embedded spreadsheet with the following:) 
      * Columns: 
        * Month (auto-set and read-only; in the format of "<Month> <Year>"; displays a row for each of the next 10 future months in which a Check-In will be due up to 5 years in the future, according to the Region's Check-In Schedule) 
      * Automatically sorted by: Month (current or nearest month at the top) 
      * Show 10 rows without scrolling 



  


  * Included Customers (bottom report; displays the Customers by Region Report, filtered to the Region, at the bottom of the screen)



  


Data Access:

  * View and edit: All users 



  


Special Considerations:

  * Copy Record: N/A
  * Delete Record: Prevent deletion if the record is referenced anywhere in the Solution: "This Region cannot be deleted because it is referenced by another record in the database."
  * Merge Record: N/A



  


Other Notes:

  * Additional validation: Show a warning on Save if any changes are made: "You are making changes to this Region that will affect all linked customers. Are you sure you want to continue?"
  * Note that this record should have a name, date, and time stamp for Created and Last Modified, as well as a link to access Modification History (standard).



  


Development Specification

Mockup: [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1XpXzA29sECIbqfYOQC6VPagvOEh1uuhErBS-LsAFhV8/edit#gid=405554444](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1XpXzA29sECIbqfYOQC6VPagvOEh1uuhErBS-LsAFhV8/edit#gid=405554444)

  


Ellis Miller 09/21/2023: 

  


[ ] Lookup record for "Regions"

[ ] Validation

[ ] Active checkbox

[ ] One month required (record validation: "At least one month must be selected for Scheduled Check-Ins.")

Bid: 4 hours

  


Check-in Settings: Similar to EmailReminders / Scheduled Tasks, but we use numbers like Scheduled Tasks

  


[ ] The Months checkboxes are macros that we can clone from Scheduled Tasks (TaskMonthlyEveryMonth / TaskMonthCheckBox)

[ ] Sort Months RG in numeric order. Something like: Value(RegionMonth) 

  


![](data:image/png;base64,)

![](data:image/png;base64,)

Bid:  4 Hours

  


  


Checkin Calculations

We always use FirstCalDay for schedule months and then have a FormatDisplay macro to format as "MMMM YYYY" and FormatSort to format as "YYYY-MM"

[ ] Macros:

[ ] Check-in month schedule (similar to what we do for EmailReminders, but that has month names). 

[ ] Next check-in month

  


[ ] Future Checkins Macro:

Assign vMonthsList = "1|2|7|12"; { TODO: From RG}

Assign vMonthsIncrementList = NumericPipeList( 0, 60);

  


ListSubstitute( vMonthsIncrementList

              , Assign vDateToCheck = FirstCalDay( Today, Value( CurrentItem));

                Assign vMonthNumToCheck = String( Month( vDateToCheck));

                If( In( vMonthNumToCheck, vMOnthsList), DateSortString( vDateToCheck), '')

              )

  


Bottom report

[ ] Simple, based on report on menu
